content.body: When I click on the rd-token> or n-token> links, they do not anchor to their respective definitions. Here is the link to the webpage where this issue is occurring: https://www.w3.org/TR/css-syntax-3/#error-handling.

content.body:
> <@chargeitall:matrix.org> I am trying to get my head used to read dry technical documentation and got stuck here ðŸ‘‰When I click on the rd-token> or n-token> links, they do not anchor to their respective definitions. Here is the link to the webpage where this issue is occurring: https://www.w3.org/TR/css-syntax-3/#error-handling.

I figured it out. the ADHD reading extension using bionic reading format omitted the characters  before n-token
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @chargeitall:matrix.org
I am trying to get my head used to read dry technical documentation and got stuck here ðŸ‘‰When I click on the rd-token> or n-token> links, they do not anchor to their respective definitions. Here is the link to the webpage where this issue is occurring: https://www.w3.org/TR/css-syntax-3/#error-handling.
I figured it out. the ADHD reading extension using bionic reading format omitted the characters before n-token
